title: San Marino
summary: San Marino (/ˌsæn məˈriːnoʊ/ (listen), Italian: [sam maˈriːno]), officially the Republic of San Marino[1][2] (Italian: Repubblica di San Marino; Romagnol: Ripóbblica d' San Marein), also known as the Most Serene Republic of San Marino[8] (Italian: Serenissima Repubblica di San Marino), is a small country[9][10][11][12] (and a European microstate) in Southern Europe enclaved by Italy.[13] Located on the northeastern side of the Apennine Mountains, San Marino covers a land area of just over 61 km2 (24 sq mi), and has a population of 33,562.[14]
